Petition of Antônio de Melo e Albuquerque to the General-in-Chief

Most Illustrious and Excellent General-in-Chief

The honorable Colonel Antônio de Melo e Albuquerque states that he, the Petitioner, after having rendered the services proven by the documents numbered 1 to 8 (which he implores Your Excellency regarding Passo Fundo (brigade assembled and created by the Petitioner), and having obtained from the Most Excellent Senhor Labatut permission to go to his home in the village of Cruz Alta, next to the same place, this was granted to him, and immediately in the same days of the Petitioner’s march, by an order of the day from that general dated December 8, 1840, the brigade under the command of the Petitioner was dissolved, creating from it a corps, without giving any destination to the Petitioner, nor was the slightest fault attributed to him! The Petitioner was taken by surprise at seeing such conduct, emanating from ridiculous intrigues plotted by cowardly envious persons; and seeing that he no longer had a position in that division, he proceeded to this place and presented himself successively not only to the Most Excellent Senhor Alvares Machado, but also to the Most Excellent current President and to Your Excellency Your Excellency Your Excellency Cima da Serra and promoted there a new reaction, to which Your Excellency Most Excellent Senhor Most Excellent Senhor Your Excellency December 9, 1840 until March 17, 1842, when by Your Excellency

He asks Your Excellency

He hopes to receive grace Porto Alegre, May 24, 1842. Antônio de Melo e Albuquerque Honorary Colonel

Report to the Military Fund, General Headquarters in Porto Alegre, May 24, 1842. Count of Rio Pardo.
